alert.note: Alert for Furnas (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Hastings (North Central Kansas and South Central Nebraska)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 28 at 9:30PM CDT until May 29 at 1:00PM CDT by NWS Hastings
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Nebraska... Republican River At Cambridge affecting Furnas County. For the REPUBLICAN RIVER...including Cambridge...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY MONDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Republican River At Cambridge, with this Warning also valid downstream to the Furnas/Harlan County line. * WHEN...Until early Monday afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 9.0 feet, Minor lowland flooding occurs as the right bank overflows. Water will start flowing through sloughs south of the main channel. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:45 PM CDT Sunday the stage was 8.7 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to remain fairly steady around 9.0 ft tonight, and rise above flood stage to a crest of 9.1 feet early Monday morning. It will then fall below flood stage mid to late Monday morning. Please note that there is the possibility of additional rain within the Republican River basin through tonight that if heavy enough could cause deviations from the current forecast. - Flood stage is 9.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov.
